creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
description: leaflike form; texturized with thin, subtle, raised parallel "spines" of thin bamboo strips; black lacquer with some exposed bamboo; gently upturning sides
medium: Lacquer and hemp cloth on thin bamboo (misudake)
text: Igawa also creates leaf-shaped forms that can be embellished with metallic powders of various colors. He devised the uneven surface of this sculpture by aligning strips of thin bamboo (misudake). This irregularity, caused by the bamboo nodes, gives the piece the appearance of a bird’s wing.
title: Sound of the Wind
